dxf2svg.svg
Class SvgMultiLineText

java.lang.Object
  dxf2svg.svg.SvgElement
      dxf2svg.svg.SvgObject
          dxf2svg.svg.SvgText
              dxf2svg.svg.SvgMultiLineText
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public final class SvgMultiLineText
extends SvgText

This class encapsulate a Svg multi-line text object. All fonts used in the conversion should be TrueType® fonts. All non-truetype fonts will be substuted with Txt.ttf as of release 0.01 of Dxf2Svg. A URL to a specific font can also be specified. This URL need not be on this system and TableStyles.setPrimaryFontFileName(java.lang.String) does not test for valid TrueType fonts and includes the URL in the @font-face Cascading Style Sheet regardless.

Note: SvgText elements can mutate into <desc> elements if their anchor point (insertion point) is outside of the limits rectangle (see LimitsFrame for more information).

Version:
0.01 - November 13, 2002
Author:
Andrew Nisbet

addAnotherString

public void addAnotherString(java.lang.String line)
Adds a string to the group of string(s) that make up a multi-line text box.

setGroupCodeThree

public void setGroupCodeThree(boolean areThereGroupThreeCodes)
This sets a switch to let the object know that there is more than 250 characters to be displayed and the initial data string needs to be output last as per the Dxf specification.

setMaxLineWidth

public void setMaxLineWidth(double width)
Sets the width defining rectangle that constrains mtext. The value is converted to UserUnits.

setXAxisDirectionVector

public void setXAxisDirectionVector(double x,
                                    double y)
Sets rotation angle of text by means of an Acad vector defined by x and y values gleened from group codes '11' and '21' respectively. This may over write any current Rotation value already stored by group code '50', but the DXF spefication says that the last value set wins.

setLineSpacingFactor

public void setLineSpacingFactor(double factor)
This method sets the line spacing or leading factor as a percentage of the default '3-on-5' line spacing to be applied. The valid range of values is from 0.25 to 4.00.
